Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.datastorage

Class RSDataContainer

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.datastorage.RSDataContainer
public class RSDataContainer
extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    RSDataContainer​(DataContainer dCont)
    Construct a new specific DataContainer for database requests.

  • Constructor Details

    • RSDataContainer

      public RSDataContainer​(DataContainer dCont)
      Construct a new specific DataContainer for database requests.
      Parameters:
      dCont - the DataContainer instance to use it in the read and write methods of this specific data container

  • Method Details

    • readData

      public void readData​(Filter filter)
      Reads data from a ResultSet and puts it into the DataContainer.
      Parameters:
      filter - Filter parameter to accomplish interface requirement (has no use here)

    • writeData

      public void writeData​(String srcFile)

    • addField

      public default void addField​(String headerName, String value, Filter fltr)
      The addField(String, String, Filter) method can be implemented within the specific DataContainer to add a field and value into the data source. Primarily the method is designed for data formats, where single nodes or similar elements can be addressed, instead of columns or rows with multiple values. e.g. the implemented method XMLDataContainer.addField(String, String, Filter) adds a tag into the XML document.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the element that will be added into the data source.
      value - Value that will be assigned to the element.
      fltr - Filter condition for more precise localization of the element within the data structure.

    • addField

      public default void addField​(String headerName, String attributeName, String attributeValue, Filter fltr)
      The addField(String, String, String, Filter) method can be implemented within the specific DataContainer to add an attribute name and value to a field within the data source. Primarily the method is designed for data formats, where single nodes or similar elements can be addressed, instead of columns or rows with multiple values. e.g. the implemented method XMLDataContainer.addField(String, String, String, Filter) adds an attribute name and value to a tag within the XML document.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the element where to add an attribute within the data source.
      attributeName - Name of the attribute that will be assigned to the element.
      attributeValue - Value that will be assigned to the attribute.
      fltr - Filter condition for more precise localization of the element within the data structure.

    • addField

      public default void addField​(String headerName, String attributeName, String oldAttrValue, String attributeValue, Filter fltr)
      The addField(String, String, String, String, Filter) method can be implemented within the specific DataContainer to add an attribute name and value to a field within the data source. Primarily the method is designed for data formats, where single nodes or similar elements can be addressed, instead of columns or rows with multiple values. e.g. the implemented method XMLDataContainer.addField(String, String, String, String, Filter) adds an attribute name and value to a tag within the XML document.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the element where to add an attribute within the data source.
      attributeName - Name of the attribute that will be assigned to the element.
      oldAttrValue - Value of existing attribute to search for and overwrite, if exists.
      attributeValue - Value that will be assigned to the attribute.
      fltr - Filter condition for more precise localization of the element within the data structure.

    • deleteField

      public default void deleteField​(String headerName, String attributeName, String attributeValue, Filter fltr)
      The deleteField(String, String, String, Filter) method can be implemented within the specific DataContainer to delete an attribute name and value from a field within the data source. Primarily the method is designed for data formats, where single nodes or similar elements can be addressed, instead of columns or rows with multiple values. e.g. the implemented method XMLDataContainer.deleteField(String, String, String, Filter) deletes an attribute name and value from a tag within the XML document.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the element where to delete an attribute from within the data source.
      attributeName - Name of the attribute that will be deleted from the element.
      attributeValue - Attribute value that will be deleted with the attribute.
      fltr - Filter condition for more precise localization of the element within the data structure.

    • getAttributes

      public default String[] getAttributes​(String expr, String attrName)
      The getAttributes(String, String) method can be implemented within the specific DataContainer in case that the fields of the data source have additional attributes attached. e.g.: The XMLDataContainer.getAttributes(String, String) searches for all tags with specific attributes like <CountryCode name="Germany">+49</CountryCode>
      Parameters:
      expr - Element to search for -> the individual purpose of this parameter will be specified within the implementing classes
      attrName - Name of the attribute to search for -> the individual purpose of this parameter will be specified within the implementing classes
      Returns:
      String Array with all attribute values found by the search expression and attribute name

    • getColumn

      public default Object[] getColumn​(String headerName, Filter rowFilter) throws Exception
      The getColumn(String, Filter) method can be implemented within the specific DataContainer to retrieve all or a filtered amount of field values from a column, if the data is in tabular format.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the column header, where the method will get the values from.
      rowFilter - The row filter defines the conditions for values found in the column. Only values that match the conditions will be retrieved.
      Returns:
      Array with all resulting values.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • setFieldValues

      public default void setFieldValues​(String headerName, int[] occurences, String value, Filter fltr)
      The setFieldValues(String, int[], String, Filter) method can be implemented within the specific DataContainer to assign a value to one or multiple elements that match a filter condition. This can be convenient for tree and tabular formats.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Name of the element where to add an attribute within the data source.
      occurences - Integer array with the index numbers of occurences, where to set the value.
      value - The value that will be assigned to the elements.
      fltr - Filter condition of the elements to search for.
